4.arg: Nomás te cal entender UNA cosa sobre cómo CORRE un coronavirus
4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

12.arg: Lo virus corre quan estas gotichonas

13.arg: Queda-te leixos. A dos metros serás a salvo d’as gotetas mas grans
13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

17.arg: Per ixo, si veyes a belún que ye tusindo / estarnudando / malaudo
17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

18.arg: Da-les una careta. Pueden tusir u estarnudar en ella y protechen a totz los d’alredor.
18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.

22.arg: Talment no siga malauda, nomás ye protechendo-se
22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

23.arg: Las personas infectadas puede que no amuestren simptomas, pero son igualment infecciosas
23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

24.arg: Y en cheneral, s’ha de privar qualsequier aglomeración de chent, perque no sabes quí puede estar malaudo.
24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

32.arg: Y mesmo l’exterior d’a tuya careta
32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

38.arg: Manimenos, la saliva d’una persona malauda puede arribar ta atras cosas…
38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

40.arg: u la cara d’o tuyo amor

42.arg: Y si tocas qualsequiera d’estas cosas per accident y dimpués te tocas la cara
42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

43.arg: y la sola manera efectiva de librar-nos d’ells ye limpiar-los con sabón, leixiva u alcol
43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

44.arg: Los virus pueden permaneixer bellas quantas horas en os obchectos
44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

47.arg: Per ixo, ye bueno que sigamos estes
47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.arg: No te toques la cara. (Ni toques la cara d’otri). Si l’has de fer, lava-te antes las mans concienzudament con sabón.
51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

52.arg: Lo que cuesta cantar dos vegadas “Bufa ixas velas!”
52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

56.arg: lava lo dorso d’as tuyas mans
56.eng: wash the back of your hands

58.arg: Si lo fas, no te’n fagas. Lava-te las mans con sabón chusto dimpuesas.
58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

59.arg: Mira de no tocar tampoco l’exterior d’a careta
59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

61.arg: *Las bacterias creixerán endentro si portas la careta masiau tiempo
61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

62.arg: Tira la careta malas que la notes puerca. No en portes una per mas d’un día.
62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

67.arg: Cadaún ha de tener la suya propia tovalla

68.arg: No compartas comida, cubiertos, tazas, tovallas.
68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

69.arg: No te toques la cara con o codo, ni anque l’intentes
69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

70.arg: Siempre que puedas, ubre y zarra las puertas con os tuyos ancons u huembros en cuenta de con as mans.
70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

72.arg: y dimpués d’estar difuera de casa
72.eng: and after being out in the public

74.arg: Lava-te siempre las mans con sabón…
74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

80.arg: Leye los articlos pa mas consellos!
80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!

81.arg: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" por Chia Yi Hou, en Business Insider (21 de enero de 2020)
81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

82.arg: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", por Laurie Garrett, en Foreign Policy, Repert. (25 de enero de 2020)
82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

83.arg: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands" por Elizabeth Sosenthal, en The New York Times, Opinion. (28 de enero de 2020)
83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

85.arg:
Notas adicionals: Las midas d’hichiene que se presentan en o comic son efectivas en prevenir muitas atras  infeccions comuns, como la gripe y lo resfriau, y son siempre recomendables, mesmo quan no i haiga garra pasa.
Referencias: La información presentada en o comic se basa en o que se conoix d’a COVID19 dica lo 28 de febrero de 2020, mas que mas d’estas referencias:﻿
﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-preventiontips.html﻿﻿https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/﻿﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Información adicional: Una version PDF d’o comic ye disponible pa la suya descarga libre aquí: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart
Normas pa compartir-lo: Qualsequier persona puede compartir este comic de manera libre y gratuita, tanto vía web como per Whatsapp u Telegram. Qualsequiera que lo descargue puede imprentar-lo como cartels pa uso personal u educativo en casas, escuelas y centros de treballo. Si lo compartes, para cuenta d’estes tres puntos: 1) No se pueden compartir versions editadas d’o comic. 2) No se pueden usar los comics pa garra prochecto comercial 3) Si lo compartes en linia, da credito a lo creador en FB etiquetando a @weimankowart, en Instagram etiquetando a @weimankow, u incluyindo un vinclo ta instagram.com/weimankow
Pa qualsequier atro uso, ninvia una petición ta lo correu: comicsforgood@gmail.com
85.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com

90.arg: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow

bookText.arg:
Lo coronavirus



Nomás te cal entender UNA cosa sobre cómo CORRE un coronavirus

boca
nariz
uellos
arriban ta los tuyos
Persona sana
Persona infectada
Lo virus corre quan estas gotichonas
Queda-te leixos. A dos metros serás a salvo d’as gotetas mas grans
1
2m
Achús!
Per ixo, si veyes a belún que ye tusindo / estarnudando / malaudo
Da-les una careta. Pueden tusir u estarnudar en ella y protechen a totz los d’alredor.
2
Gracias
﻿*snif*
U
Talment no siga malauda, nomás ye protechendo-se
Las personas infectadas puede que no amuestren simptomas, pero son igualment infecciosas
Y en cheneral, s’ha de privar qualsequier aglomeración de chent, perque no sabes quí puede estar malaudo.
Tochetz
Persona sana
Agarraderas
Botons de l’ascensor
Moquers
Tazas
Dispositivos dichitals
Y mesmo l’exterior d’a tuya careta
Barandau
Ratet
Boligrafos
Pomos de puerta
Las suyas mans
Manimenos, la saliva d’una persona malauda puede arribar ta atras cosas…
podríatz cayer malaudos
u la cara d’o tuyo amor
t’estregas los uellos
Y si tocas qualsequiera d’estas cosas per accident y dimpués te tocas la cara
y la sola manera efectiva de librar-nos d’ells ye limpiar-los con sabón, leixiva u alcol
Los virus pueden permaneixer bellas quantas horas en os obchectos
Sabón
consellos
Per ixo, ye bueno que sigamos estes
Lava-te con sabón dica aquí
Sabón
Ancón
No te toques la cara. (Ni toques la cara d’otri). Si l’has de fer, lava-te antes las mans concienzudament con sabón.
Lo que cuesta cantar dos vegadas “Bufa ixas velas!”
baixo las unglas
per 20 segundos
entre los didos
lava lo dorso d’as tuyas mans
Qué ye “concienzudament”?
Si lo fas, no te’n fagas. Lava-te las mans con sabón chusto dimpuesas.
Mira de no tocar tampoco l’exterior d’a careta
gotetas
*Las bacterias creixerán endentro si portas la careta masiau tiempo
Tira la careta malas que la notes puerca. No en portes una per mas d’un día.
Usa un cullar pa servir
Bebé
Papa
Mama
Cadaún ha de tener la suya propia tovalla
No compartas comida, cubiertos, tazas, tovallas.
No te toques la cara con o codo, ni anque l’intentes
Siempre que puedas, ubre y zarra las puertas con os tuyos ancons u huembros en cuenta de con as mans.
Casa mía
y dimpués d’estar difuera de casa
Antes de minchar
Lava-te siempre las mans con sabón…
Y pa rematar,
sabón
Guardatz-tos de malo!
Guardatz-tos de malo!
sabón
Leye los articlos pa mas consellos!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" por Chia Yi Hou, en Business Insider (21 de enero de 2020)
"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", por Laurie Garrett, en Foreign Policy, Repert. (25 de enero de 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands" por Elizabeth Sosenthal, en The New York Times, Opinion. (28 de enero de 2020)
Referencias principals d’información medica
Notas adicionals: Las midas d’hichiene que se presentan en o comic son efectivas en prevenir muitas atras  infeccions comuns, como la gripe y lo resfriau, y son siempre recomendables, mesmo quan no i haiga garra pasa.
Referencias: La información presentada en o comic se basa en o que se conoix d’a COVID19 dica lo 28 de febrero de 2020, mas que mas d’estas referencias:﻿
﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-preventiontips.html﻿﻿https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/﻿﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Información adicional: Una version PDF d’o comic ye disponible pa la suya descarga libre aquí: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart
Normas pa compartir-lo: Qualsequier persona puede compartir este comic de manera libre y gratuita, tanto vía web como per Whatsapp u Telegram. Qualsequiera que lo descargue puede imprentar-lo como cartels pa uso personal u educativo en casas, escuelas y centros de treballo. Si lo compartes, para cuenta d’estes tres puntos: 1) No se pueden compartir versions editadas d’o comic. 2) No se pueden usar los comics pa garra prochecto comercial 3) Si lo compartes en linia, da credito a lo creador en FB etiquetando a @weimankowart, en Instagram etiquetando a @weimankow, u incluyindo un vinclo ta instagram.com/weimankow
Pa qualsequier atro uso, ninvia una petición ta lo correu: comicsforgood@gmail.com

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
Chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
Main references for medical info:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com

title: Lo coronavirus
